p: At the maximal non-toxic concentrations of 375 μg/ml, this polar fraction exhibited a pronounced antiviral activity (reduction factor of the viral titer (RF) of 10 3 – 10 4) against Herpes simplex virus type 1, Poliomyelitis virus type 1 strain 1A/S3 and Semliki forest virus A7, while at 187.5 μg/ml it displayed a RF of 10 3 against Coxsackie B2 virus. RF values of 10 2 were observed against Vesicular stomatitis virus T2 and measles Edmonston A at 187.5 and 750 μg/ml, respectively ( Cos et al., 2002b).
